title: Akagami no Shirayuki-hime
description:
Akagami no Shirayuki-hime (also known as Snow White with the Red Hair) is a Japanese anime based on the manga by Sorata Akizuki. It follows the story of Shirayuki, a young woman with unique red hair who catches the eye of a prince. Seeking to escape his unwanted advances, she flees her kingdom and eventually meets Zen, a kind prince who helps her. Shirayuki becomes involved in the world of royalty and political intrigue, navigating her newfound life while building relationships with Zen and his friends.

The anime has two seasons:
Season 1: 12 episodes
Season 2: 12 episodes
In total, there are 24 episodes of Akagami no Shirayuki-hime.
disclaimer: Contains romantic themes suitable for a young adult audience. Generally family-friendly with some mature undertones.

title: Angel Beats!
description:
Angel Beats! is a Japanese anime series set in the afterlife, where a group of high school students find themselves in a strange world resembling a school. These students have all died and are now in limbo, unable to remember their past lives. The main character, Otonashi, arrives without any memories and meets a girl named Yuri, who leads a group of students in a resistance against an enigmatic figure known as "Angel." As the series progresses, Otonashi learns more about the mysterious nature of this afterlife and the students' unresolved issues, leading them to discover peace and move on to the next stage.

Angel Beats! has 13 episodes, which aired in 2010, plus an additional OVA episode.
disclaimer: Features themes of life, death, and the afterlife. Contains some emotional and dramatic moments that may be intense for sensitive viewers.

title: Attack on Titan
description:
Attack on Titan (Shingeki no Kyojin) is a Japanese anime based on the manga by Hajime Isayama. The story is set in a world where humanity is on the brink of extinction due to giant humanoid creatures known as Titans that devour humans. The remaining survivors live within massive walled cities to protect themselves. The protagonist, Eren Yeager, joins the military after his hometown is destroyed and his mother is killed by a Titan. Along with his friends Mikasa and Armin, Eren discovers shocking secrets about the Titans and the true nature of their world, leading them into a battle for humanity's survival.

The anime has been divided into multiple seasons:
Season 1: 25 episodes (2013)
Season 2: 12 episodes (2017)
Season 3:
Part 1: 12 episodes (2018)
Part 2: 10 episodes (2018)
Season 4 (Final Season):
Part 1: 16 episodes (2020-2021)
Part 2: 12 episodes (2022)
Part 3: Scheduled in two parts, with the first part released in 2023 and the final part set for 2024.
As of now, there are a total of 88 episodes aired, with the final season still ongoing.
disclaimer: Contains graphic violence, intense action scenes, and mature themes of war and survival. Viewer discretion is advised.

title: Black Clover
description:
Black Clover is a Japanese anime based on the manga by Y?ki Tabata. The story follows Asta, a boy born without any magical power in a world where magic is everything. Despite this, he dreams of becoming the Wizard King, the most powerful mage in the Clover Kingdom. With his determination and the help of his rival and friend Yuno, who is highly gifted in magic, Asta embarks on a journey to achieve his dream. Along the way, he joins the Black Bulls, a group of misfit mages, and faces numerous challenges and enemies while uncovering secrets about the magical world.

Black Clover has 170 episodes, which aired from October 2017 to March 2021. The anime is currently on a hiatus after airing its final episode in 2021, but there is a planned movie continuation, Black Clover: Sword of the Wizard King, released in 2023.
disclaimer: Features action and battle sequences with some violence. Suitable for younger audiences with strong themes of perseverance and rivalry.

title: Bleach
description:
Bleach is a Japanese anime series based on Tite Kubo's manga of the same name. It follows Ichigo Kurosaki, a teenager with the ability to see ghosts. His life changes when he accidentally gains the powers of a Soul Reaper, a guardian who protects the living from evil spirits called Hollows. Ichigo is tasked with protecting the living world and guiding lost souls to the afterlife, while uncovering the mysteries surrounding the spiritual realms.

The series includes various story arcs involving intense battles, soul reapers, and other supernatural beings.

Total Number of Episodes:
Bleach (Original Series): 366 episodes (aired from 2004 to 2012).
Bleach: Thousand-Year Blood War (2022-ongoing): The new arc started in 2022 and is still being aired, with more episodes expected in the future.
So far, there are 366 episodes in the original series, with additional episodes for the ongoing arc.
disclaimer: Includes battles and violent themes. While generally accessible to a wide audience, it may include some intense moments.

title: Bungo Stray Dogs
description:
Bungo Stray Dogs is a Japanese anime based on the manga by Kafka Asagiri and Sango Harukawa. The story follows Atsushi Nakajima, a young man who is kicked out of his orphanage and finds himself in a city filled with individuals who possess supernatural abilities. He encounters the Armed Detective Agency, a group of people with unique powers who work together to solve mysteries and fight dangerous criminal organizations. Atsushi eventually joins the agency and begins to uncover the secrets surrounding his own abilities, as well as the dark underworld of the city. The series blends action, supernatural elements, and literary references, as many characters are named after famous authors and their powers are inspired by their works.

Bungo Stray Dogs has 4 seasons:
Season 1 – 12 episodes, aired from April to June 2016.
Season 2 – 12 episodes, aired from October to December 2016.
Season 3 – 12 episodes, aired from April to June 2019.
Season 4 – 13 episodes, aired from January to March 2023.
In total, Bungo Stray Dogs has 49 episodes across all seasons.
disclaimer: Contains themes of supernatural powers and gang violence. Includes complex characters and occasional violence.

title: Charlotte
description:
Charlotte is a Japanese anime series created by Jun Maeda and produced by P.A. Works. The story follows Yuu Otosaka, a teenage boy with the ability to temporarily possess anyone's body for five seconds. However, his life changes when he is caught using his power and is sent to a special school for students with supernatural abilities. At this school, Yuu meets other students who have unique powers and begins to unravel a larger conspiracy surrounding their abilities.

The anime combines drama, romance, and supernatural elements, exploring themes of responsibility, sacrifice, and the consequences of using powers for personal gain.

Total Number of Episodes:
Charlotte: 13 episodes (aired in 2015)
Thus, Charlotte has a total of 13 episodes.
disclaimer: Deals with themes of superpowers, loss, and existential questions. Includes emotional and dramatic moments that may be intense for younger viewers.

title: Clannad
description:
Clannad is a Japanese anime series based on a visual novel by Key. The story follows Tomoya Okazaki, a high school delinquent who meets a strange girl named Nagisa Furukawa. Together, they form a group with other students and become involved in various personal struggles and emotional experiences. As Tomoya helps his friends face their challenges, he uncovers deeper, heartfelt connections and learns about love, family, and the impact of the past. The anime combines drama, romance, and supernatural elements.

The series explores themes of family, friendship, and the consequences of past actions, with a particularly emotional and heartwarming conclusion.

Total Number of Episodes:
Clannad (2007): 23 episodes + 1 OVA (Original Video Animation)
Clannad: After Story (2008-2009): 24 episodes + 1 OVA
Thus, Clannad has a total of 47 episodes (including both the original series and its sequel).
disclaimer: Contains emotional and dramatic themes centered around family, love, and loss. Viewer discretion is advised for sensitive viewers.

title: Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion
description:
Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion is a Japanese anime series created by Sunrise, with direction by Gor? Taniguchi and writing by Ichir? ?kouchi. The story is set in an alternate future where the Holy Britannian Empire has conquered Japan, renaming it Area 11. The protagonist, Lelouch vi Britannia, a former prince of Britannia, gains a mysterious power called Geass, which allows him to control people's actions with direct eye contact.

Lelouch, using the alias Zero, leads a resistance group called the Black Knights to overthrow the tyrannical empire. The series follows Lelouch’s strategic genius as he fights to bring down Britannia, while dealing with his own moral dilemmas, complex relationships, and the personal consequences of his actions.

Total Number of Episodes:
Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion (Season 1): 25 episodes (aired in 2006-2007)
Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion R2 (Season 2): 25 episodes (aired in 2008)
Thus, Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion has a total of 50 episodes across both seasons.
disclaimer: Contains political intrigue, violence, and mature themes surrounding rebellion and war. Viewer discretion is recommended.

title: Cowboy Bebop
description:
Cowboy Bebop is a Japanese anime set in a futuristic world where bounty hunters, known as cowboys, travel across space in pursuit of criminals. The story follows Spike Spiegel, a former hitman with a troubled past, and his ragtag crew aboard the spaceship Bebop. The crew includes Jet Black, a former cop; Faye Valentine, a mysterious and resourceful woman with amnesia; Edward, a quirky and genius hacker; and Ein, a genetically enhanced dog.

The series blends action, drama, and comedy as the crew takes on various bounty hunting missions, but it also delves deeply into the characters' pasts, exploring themes of loneliness, regret, and the search for meaning. Each episode often functions as a self-contained story, while also building on the overarching narratives of the characters’ complex relationships and personal struggles.

Cowboy Bebop is renowned for its stylish animation, memorable music (especially its jazz soundtrack), and philosophical undertones, making it a beloved classic in the anime world.

Total Number of Episodes:
Cowboy Bebop has a total of 26 episodes.
disclaimer: Contains mature themes, including violence, existentialism, and dark humor. Suitable for adult viewers.

title: Death Note
description:
Death Note is a Japanese anime series based on the manga written by Tsugumi Ohba and illustrated by Takeshi Obata. The story follows Light Yagami, a brilliant high school student who discovers a mysterious notebook called the Death Note. This notebook allows its user to kill anyone whose name is written in it, as long as they know the person's face. With the power to eliminate criminals, Light sets out to create a utopia free of crime, assuming the identity of a god-like figure known as Kira.

However, Light's actions attract the attention of a highly intelligent and eccentric detective known as L, who is determined to capture Kira. A high-stakes game of cat and mouse ensues between Light and L, with both trying to outsmart each other. As the series progresses, it explores themes of morality, justice, and the consequences of absolute power.

Death Note is known for its psychological depth, intense mind games, and moral ambiguity.

Total Number of Episodes:
Death Note has a total of 37 episodes.
disclaimer: Features psychological battles and themes surrounding death, morality, and justice. Contains violence and intense psychological elements.

title: Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba
description:
Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba is a Japanese anime series based on the manga by Koyoharu Gotouge. The story is set in Taisho-era Japan and follows Tanjiro Kamado, a kind-hearted young boy who becomes a demon slayer after his family is slaughtered by demons, and his younger sister Nezuko is turned into a demon. Determined to avenge his family and find a cure for Nezuko, Tanjiro joins the Demon Slayer Corps, an organization dedicated to hunting demons and protecting humanity.

Throughout the series, Tanjiro faces various powerful demons, learns combat techniques, and uncovers the dark history behind the demon epidemic. Along the way, he is joined by fellow demon slayers, including Zenitsu Agatsuma and Inosuke Hashibira, each with their own strengths and personal struggles. The anime is known for its stunning animation, emotional storytelling, and intense action sequences.

Total Number of Episodes:
Season 1 (Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba): 26 episodes
Mugen Train Arc (a direct sequel to Season 1): 7 episodes (released as a mini-series)
Season 2 (Entertainment District Arc): 11 episodes
Season 3 (Swordsmith Village Arc): Currently airing, expected to have around 11 episodes
As of now, Demon Slayer has 44 episodes, with more episodes and arcs planned for future seasons.
disclaimer: Contains intense action and violence involving demons. While accessible to most audiences, it includes some graphic depictions of violence.

title: Dragon Ball
description:
Dragon Ball is a Japanese anime series based on the manga written and illustrated by Akira Toriyama. The series follows Goku, a young boy with a tail who is trained in martial arts by his grandfather, Gohan. Goku embarks on an adventure to find the Dragon Balls, seven magical orbs that can summon a dragon capable of granting any wish. Along the way, Goku makes many friends, including Bulma, Yamcha, Krillin, and others, as they face powerful foes and seek to protect Earth from various threats.

The anime covers Goku's early life, his training, and adventures, leading up to major battles, such as the World Martial Arts Tournaments, as well as encounters with various villains, like Emperor Pilaf, King Piccolo, and Tien. The series is famous for its dynamic fight scenes, humor, and iconic characters, and it has become a cornerstone of the action and shonen anime genres.

Total Number of Episodes:
Dragon Ball (original series) has a total of 153 episodes.
The series covers Goku’s childhood up until his early adulthood.
Note: The Dragon Ball franchise has several sequels and spin-offs, including Dragon Ball Z, Dragon Ball Super, and others, which further expand on Goku's adventures.
disclaimer: Contains action, violence, and comedic elements suitable for a broad audience. Some episodes may feature exaggerated action violence.

title: Erased
description:
"Erased" (Boku dake ga Inai Machi) is a suspenseful, mystery-filled anime about Satoru Fujinuma, a 29-year-old manga artist with the ability to travel back in time to moments just before a life-threatening event occurs. When his mother is murdered, Satoru's ability unexpectedly sends him 18 years into the past, where he must solve the mystery of his mother's death while also preventing the abduction and murder of his classmates. As Satoru unravels the mystery, he discovers a deeper conspiracy involving childhood trauma.

Total Episodes: 12 episodes.
disclaimer: Contains suspenseful and emotional themes involving murder, child abduction, and trauma. Viewer discretion is advised, especially for sensitive audiences due to disturbing themes related to violence and loss.

title: Fairy Tail
description:
Fairy Tail is a Japanese anime series based on the manga by Hiro Mashima. The story takes place in a magical world where wizards belong to guilds that take on various jobs and missions. The protagonist, Natsu Dragneel, is a fire dragon slayer who is a member of the Fairy Tail Guild, one of the most famous and powerful guilds in the world. Along with his friends, including Lucy Heartfilia, a celestial spirit mage, Gray Fullbuster, an ice mage, and Erza Scarlet, a skilled warrior, Natsu embarks on numerous adventures, battles powerful enemies, and faces both personal and guild-wide challenges.

The series explores themes of friendship, loyalty, and the bonds formed between the guild members as they grow stronger together. Fairy Tail is known for its action-packed battles, humorous moments, and emotional story arcs.

Total Number of Episodes:
Fairy Tail (Season 1): 175 episodes
Fairy Tail: Final Series: 51 episodes
In total, Fairy Tail has 328 episodes across its main series and the final season.
disclaimer: Contains action, fantasy violence, and occasional fanservice. While generally lighthearted, some scenes may be intense for younger audiences.

title: Fruits Basket
description:
Fruits Basket is a Japanese anime series based on the manga by Natsuki Takaya. The story revolves around Tohru Honda, a high school girl who becomes homeless after the death of her mother. She ends up living with the Soma family, only to discover that they are cursed: certain members of the family transform into animals of the Chinese zodiac when they are hugged by someone of the opposite sex. Tohru quickly becomes involved with the Soma family, including the brooding Yuki, the hot-headed Kyo, and the mysterious Shigure.

As Tohru becomes closer to the Somas, she learns more about their painful pasts and the curse that haunts them. The series explores themes of love, acceptance, family, and personal growth as Tohru helps the family members break free from the curse while dealing with her own emotional struggles.

Total Number of Episodes:
Fruits Basket (2001) (original adaptation): 26 episodes
Fruits Basket (2019) (full remake): 63 episodes (split into three seasons: 25 episodes in Season 1, 25 episodes in Season 2, and 13 episodes in Season 3)
In total, Fruits Basket has 89 episodes across both adaptations. The 2019 version is considered the more faithful adaptation of the manga.
disclaimer: Deals with themes of family trauma, romance, and personal growth. Some emotional moments may be intense for viewers sensitive to such themes.

title: Fullmetal Alchemist
description:
Fullmetal Alchemist is a Japanese anime series based on the manga by Hiromu Arakawa. The story is set in a world where alchemy is a widely practiced science, and it follows two brothers, Edward and Alphonse Elric, who commit a forbidden alchemical act in an attempt to bring their mother back to life. However, the ritual goes horribly wrong, and Edward loses his arm and leg, while Alphonse loses his entire body, his soul being bound to a suit of armor. The brothers embark on a quest to find the Philosopher's Stone, a powerful artifact that could restore their bodies and fix the damage caused by their failed experiment.

As they travel through the world, they uncover dark secrets about the Philosopher’s Stone, government corruption, and the existence of a powerful military organization. Themes of sacrifice, redemption, and the consequences of their actions are central to the plot.

There are two anime adaptations of Fullmetal Alchemist:

Fullmetal Alchemist (2003): This version follows the early part of the manga closely but diverges into an original storyline after a certain point due to the manga being incomplete at the time.
Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood (2009): A more faithful adaptation that sticks closely to the manga's original story, following the Elric brothers’ journey to its conclusion.
Total Number of Episodes:
Fullmetal Alchemist (2003): 51 episodes
Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood (2009): 64 episodes
In total, there are 115 episodes across both versions. "Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood" is generally considered the definitive version, as it adheres more closely to the manga's storyline.
disclaimer: Contains themes of war, sacrifice, and the human condition. May be intense due to action, violence, and emotional themes.

title: Gintama'
description:
Gintama' is the second season of the anime Gintama, which is based on the manga by Hideaki Sorachi. This season continues the story of Gintoki Sakata, a laid-back but skilled samurai living in a world where aliens have taken over feudal Japan. Gintoki, along with his friends Shinpachi Shimura and Kagura, runs the Yorozuya, a freelance business that takes on various odd jobs. The anime is known for its mix of comedy, action, and drama, often parodying other anime, pop culture, and historical events. While it balances humor with serious arcs, Gintama' continues to explore themes of loyalty, friendship, and personal growth.

Gintama' (Season 2) has 51 episodes, which aired from April 2006 to March 2007. It continues the story with more adventures and emotional moments, following the unpredictable and dynamic events of the Gintama universe.
disclaimer: Contains a mix of humor, action, and occasional violence. Suitable for mature audiences due to its parodies and adult themes.

title: Haikyuu!
description:
Haikyuu!! is a Japanese anime series based on the manga by Haruichi Furudate. The story follows Shoyo Hinata, a passionate and determined high school student who becomes inspired to play volleyball after seeing a match on TV, despite being short in stature. He joins his high school’s volleyball team, where he teams up with Kageyama Tobio, a talented but initially temperamental setter. Together, they form a dynamic duo, working to lead their team to success in various competitions.

The series focuses on Hinata's growth as a volleyball player, his relationships with his teammates, and the intense rivalry with other high school volleyball teams. It is filled with thrilling sports action, heartwarming character development, and the importance of teamwork. Haikyuu!! is widely praised for its realistic portrayal of volleyball, its emotional depth, and its well-developed cast of characters.

Total Number of Episodes:
Season 1: 25 episodes
Season 2: 25 episodes
Season 3: 10 episodes
Season 4 (Haikyuu!! To the Top): 25 episodes (split into two parts: Part 1 - 13 episodes, Part 2 - 12 episodes)
Season 5: Announced and planned for release in two parts, but the total number of episodes has yet to be finalized.
In total, Haikyuu!! currently has 85 episodes across 4 seasons, with the fifth season upcoming.
disclaimer: Focuses on sports, friendship, and teamwork with positive and inspiring themes. Suitable for younger audiences.

title: Hunter x Hunter
description:
Hunter x Hunter is a Japanese anime based on the manga by Yoshihiro Togashi. The story follows Gon Freecss, a young boy who dreams of becoming a Hunter—a special title granted to individuals with exceptional skills. Gon’s primary goal is to find his father, who abandoned him when he was a child in order to pursue his own quest as a Hunter. Along his journey, Gon befriends several companions, including Killua, a former assassin; Leorio, an aspiring doctor; and Kurapika, the last surviving member of his clan. Together, they face dangerous challenges and unravel complex mysteries while participating in the rigorous and perilous Hunter Exams, which serve as a gateway to their ultimate goals.

Hunter x Hunter has two major anime adaptations:
Hunter x Hunter (1999) – 62 episodes, aired from 1999 to 2001. This version covers the early arcs but does not finish the story.
Hunter x Hunter (2011) – 148 episodes, aired from 2011 to 2014. This version covers more of the manga arcs and includes the Chimera Ant arc and the Election arc, making it the more complete adaptation.
In total, Hunter x Hunter has 148 episodes from the 2011 version, which is the most well-known and widely watched.
disclaimer: Features violence, dark themes, and complex moral dilemmas. Contains mature themes and action suitable for older teens and adults.

title: Jujutsu Kaisen
description:
Jujutsu Kaisen is a popular anime series based on the manga written and illustrated by Gege Akutami. It follows Yuji Itadori, a high school student with extraordinary physical abilities, who becomes involved in the world of Jujutsu Sorcery after he swallows a cursed object — a finger belonging to the powerful curse Ryomen Sukuna. He is taken in by the Tokyo Metropolitan Jujutsu Technical College, where he trains under sorcerers like Satoru Gojo to fight cursed spirits and protect others from curses. The series combines intense action, dark themes, and supernatural elements with a focus on teamwork, personal growth, and moral dilemmas.

As of December 2024:
Season 1: 24 episodes
Season 2: 10 episodes (the "Shibuya Incident" arc is ongoing)
So, the total number of episodes aired is 34 episodes. However, since Season 2 is ongoing, this number will increase with future episodes.
disclaimer: Contains action, supernatural violence, and dark themes. Viewer discretion is recommended due to intense battle sequences and blood.

title: Kaguya-sama: Love is War?
description:
Kaguya-sama: Love is War is a Japanese anime based on the manga by Aka Akasaka. The story revolves around two brilliant student council members, Kaguya Shinomiya, the wealthy and poised vice president, and Miyuki Shirogane, the hardworking and highly intelligent president. Both are secretly in love with each other but are too proud to confess. Instead, they engage in an elaborate, comedic "battle" to make the other confess first. The series is a hilarious mix of romance, psychological warfare, and high school antics, filled with witty exchanges and amusing misunderstandings.

Kaguya-sama: Love is War has 3 seasons:
Season 1 – 12 episodes, aired from January to March 2019.
Season 2 – 12 episodes, aired from April to June 2020.
Season 3 – 13 episodes, aired from April to June 2022.
In total, Kaguya-sama: Love is War has 37 episodes across all seasons. Additionally, a movie Kaguya-sama: Love is War - The First Kiss That Never Ends was released in 2022.
disclaimer: Primarily a romantic comedy with some humorous psychological battles. Some adult humor and references may not be suitable for all ages.

title: Kaichou wa Maid-sama!
description:
Kaichou wa Maid-sama! is a romantic comedy anime based on the manga by Hiro Fujiwara. The story follows Misaki Ayuzawa, the first female student council president at a previously all-boys high school. Misaki is strict and tough to maintain discipline, but she secretly works part-time at a maid café to support her family. Her secret is discovered by the popular and charming student, Takumi Usui, who starts to take an interest in her. As the story progresses, Misaki and Usui develop a unique relationship, navigating the challenges of love, school life, and Misaki’s secret job.

The anime has 26 episodes in total, which aired from April to September 2010.
disclaimer: Contains romantic and comedic themes, with mild fanservice and situations that may not be suitable for younger viewers.

title: Kimi ni Todoke
description:
Kimi ni Todoke is a romantic drama anime based on the manga by Karuho Shiina. The story revolves around Sawako Kuronuma, a shy, misunderstood high school girl with a resemblance to the horror movie character Sadako. Due to her eerie appearance, she is nicknamed "Sadako" by her classmates, and as a result, is often isolated. However, her life changes when the popular and friendly boy, Shouta Kazehaya, takes an interest in her and helps her break out of her shell. As Sawako grows more confident, she navigates her feelings for Kazehaya, while also building meaningful friendships.

The anime consists of:
Season 1: 25 episodes (aired from October 2009 to March 2010)
Season 2: 12 episodes (aired from April 2011 to June 2011)
So, the total number of episodes is 37.
disclaimer: A romance focused on high school life with themes of friendship and love. Generally family-friendly, but may include some mild romantic tension.

title: Kuroko's Basketball
description:
Kuroko's Basketball (also known as Kuroko no Basuke) is a Japanese anime based on the manga by Tadatoshi Fujimaki. The story follows Taiga Kagami, a talented high school basketball player who joins Seirin High School's basketball team. He soon learns that his teammate, Tetsuya Kuroko, was a former member of the "Generation of Miracles," a legendary group of middle school basketball players renowned for their exceptional skills. Kuroko, however, is almost invisible on the court and specializes in making assists rather than scoring. Together, Kagami and Kuroko aim to lead Seirin High to victory and challenge the other members of the Generation of Miracles, each with their own unique talents, in an intense, action-packed journey to the top.

Kuroko's Basketball has 3 seasons:
Season 1 – 25 episodes, aired from April to September 2012.
Season 2 – 25 episodes, aired from October 2013 to March 2014.
Season 3 – 25 episodes, aired from January to June 2015.
In total, Kuroko's Basketball has 75 episodes across all seasons.
disclaimer: Features intense sports action and competition with themes of teamwork and rivalry. Mild violence due to competitive sports.

title: Mirai Nikki
description:
Mirai Nikki (Future Diary) is a psychological thriller and survival game anime based on the manga by Sakae Esuno. The story follows Yukiteru Amano, a lonely and introverted high school student who is given a Future Diary — a phone that predicts the future. He soon learns that he is one of 12 participants in a deadly survival game organized by Deus Ex Machina, the God of Time and Space. Each participant has a Future Diary that grants them a unique power related to their future. Among them is Yuno Gasai, a mysterious and obsessive girl who claims to love Yukiteru and becomes a key player in the game. As the game progresses, the contestants must eliminate each other to survive, leading to shocking twists and intense battles.

The anime has:
Season 1: 26 episodes (aired from October 2011 to April 2012)
OVA: 2 episodes (released in 2013, as a continuation of the story)
The total number of episodes, including the OVA, is 28.
disclaimer: Contains violence, psychological horror, and themes of survival and obsession. Viewer discretion is advised due to graphic content.

title: My Hero Academia
description:
My Hero Academia is a popular superhero anime based on the manga by Kohei Horikoshi. The story is set in a world where nearly everyone has a Quirk (superpower), except for Izuku Midoriya, a Quirkless boy who dreams of becoming a hero. Despite being born without powers, Midoriya is determined to follow in the footsteps of his idol, All Might, the world's greatest hero. After a chance encounter, All Might passes on his powerful Quirk, One For All, to Midoriya, granting him the ability to attend U.A. High School, a prestigious academy for aspiring heroes. The series follows Midoriya and his classmates as they train to become professional heroes while facing various challenges, villains, and growing threats in their world.

As of December 2024, My Hero Academia has aired:
Season 1: 13 episodes (2016)
Season 2: 25 episodes (2017)
Season 3: 25 episodes (2018)
Season 4: 25 episodes (2019–2020)
Season 5: 25 episodes (2021)
Season 6: 25 episodes (2022–2023)
Season 7: Ongoing, with episodes released in 2024 (expected to have around 25 episodes)
So, the total number of episodes, including all seasons up to Season 6, is 138.
disclaimer: Focuses on action, superheroes, and moral dilemmas. Includes violence and some intense action sequences, suitable for older teens.

title: Nana
description:
Nana is a Japanese anime series based on the manga by Ai Yazawa. It follows the lives of two women, both named Nana, who meet by chance on a train to Tokyo. One is a punk rock singer, Nana Osaki, determined to make it big in the music world, while the other, Nana Komatsu, is a sweet, naive girl who moves to the city for love and independence. Their lives become intertwined as they support each other through personal challenges, love, heartbreak, and the ups and downs of their respective careers.

The anime adaptation of Nana has 47 episodes in total. It aired from April 2006 to March 2007.
disclaimer: A drama about love, relationships, and the challenges of adulthood. Deals with emotional and romantic themes, some of which may be mature.

title: Naruto
description:
Naruto is a Japanese anime based on the manga by Masashi Kishimoto. The story follows Naruto Uzumaki, a young ninja with dreams of becoming the strongest ninja and earning the title of Hokage, the leader of his village. Naruto is an orphan, and his body holds the powerful Nine-Tails Fox, a creature that once attacked the village. Despite being shunned by others, Naruto is determined to prove his worth. The series explores themes of friendship, perseverance, and the challenges Naruto faces as he grows stronger and works to protect his loved ones.

The anime Naruto has a total of 220 episodes, airing from October 2002 to February 2007. The series is followed by a sequel, Naruto: Shippuden, which continues Naruto's journey.
disclaimer: Contains action, ninjutsu, and themes of perseverance and friendship. Mild violence and mature themes suitable for a wide audience.

title: Natsume's Book of Friends
description:
Natsume's Book of Friends (Natsume Yuujinchou) is a Japanese anime based on the manga by Yuki Midorikawa. The story follows Takashi Natsume, a high school student who can see spirits, a gift he inherited from his grandmother. Natsume comes into possession of a book that belonged to her, which contains the names of spirits she had controlled. As Natsume encounters various spirits, he decides to return their names to them, offering them freedom, and he builds relationships with both the supernatural and human world. The series explores themes of loneliness, friendship, and personal growth as Natsume navigates his complex life.

Natsume's Book of Friends has 6 seasons:
Season 1 – 13 episodes, aired from July to September 2008.
Season 2 – 13 episodes, aired from July to September 2009.
Season 3 – 13 episodes, aired from January to March 2011.
Season 4 – 13 episodes, aired from January to March 2012.
Season 5 – 11 episodes, aired from October to December 2016.
Season 6 – 11 episodes, aired from April to June 2017.
In total, Natsume's Book of Friends has 73 episodes across all seasons.
disclaimer: A calming and emotional series focused on themes of friendship and spirits. Contains gentle supernatural themes with emotional depth.

title: Neon Genesis Evangelion
description:
Neon Genesis Evangelion is a Japanese anime series created by Hideaki Anno and produced by Studio Gainax. Set in a post-apocalyptic world, the story follows Shinji Ikari, a teenager recruited by a secret organization, NERV, to pilot a giant bio-mechanical robot called an Evangelion. These robots are humanity's last line of defense against mysterious beings known as Angels, which threaten the survival of the Earth. The series delves into psychological themes such as identity, depression, and the human condition, while blending action, mecha, and apocalyptic scenarios.

The anime Neon Genesis Evangelion consists of 26 episodes, originally airing from October 1995 to March 1996. Additionally, the series was followed by several films, including The End of Evangelion, which serves as an alternative ending to the story.
disclaimer: Contains psychological themes, existentialism, and intense action. Features violence and mature themes, including mental health struggles.

title: Noragami
description:
Noragami is a Japanese anime series based on the manga written by Adachitoka. The story centers around Yato, a lesser-known deity who dreams of becoming a popular god with a grand shrine. However, he's a bit of a troublemaker and often takes on odd jobs for small payments. His life changes when he encounters a high school girl named Hiyori Iki, who is saved by Yato from an accident, but her soul becomes detached from her body. Hiyori decides to help Yato with his work, and together they team up with a weapon spirit named Yukine. The series blends supernatural action, humor, and emotional depth as the characters navigate the afterlife and confront personal struggles.

The anime Noragami has 2 seasons:
Noragami (Season 1) – 12 episodes, aired from January to March 2014.
Noragami Aragoto (Season 2) – 13 episodes, aired from October to December 2015.
In total, there are 25 episodes across both seasons.
disclaimer: Features supernatural elements, violence, and themes surrounding gods and spirits. Some intense moments suitable for older teens.

title: One Piece
description:
One Piece is a long-running Japanese anime series based on the manga by Eiichiro Oda. The story follows Monkey D. Luffy, a young pirate with the ability to stretch his body like rubber after eating a magical fruit known as the "Gomu Gomu no Mi." Luffy sets out on a quest to find the legendary treasure known as the "One Piece" and become the Pirate King. Along the way, he forms a crew, the Straw Hat Pirates, each with unique abilities and dreams. The series is known for its epic adventures, humor, emotional depth, and intricate world-building as Luffy and his crew face powerful enemies and uncover secrets of the world.

As of December 2024, One Piece has aired over 1,050 episodes, and the series is ongoing, with new episodes released weekly.
disclaimer: Contains action, adventure, and themes of friendship and dreams. Some scenes may feature cartoonish violence and are generally family-friendly.

title: One Punch Man
description:
One Punch Man is a Japanese anime based on the webcomic created by ONE and illustrated by Yusuke Murata. The series follows Saitama, an ordinary man who becomes an incredibly powerful hero capable of defeating any opponent with a single punch. Despite his overwhelming strength, Saitama grows bored and frustrated with the lack of real challenges. The anime explores his quest for a worthy opponent while parodying traditional superhero and shonen tropes. The series blends action, humor, and satirical commentary on the genre, with Saitama's overpowered nature creating both comedic and dramatic moments.

One Punch Man currently has 2 seasons:
One Punch Man (Season 1) – 12 episodes, aired from October to December 2015.
One Punch Man Season 2 – 12 episodes, aired from April to July 2019.
In total, there are 24 episodes across both seasons.
disclaimer: A satirical take on the superhero genre. Includes violence and comedy that is suitable for older teens and adults.

title: Ore Monogatari!!
description:
Ore Monogatari!! (also known as My Love Story!!) is a Japanese anime based on the manga by Kazune Kawahara. The story follows Takeo Goda, a large, strong, and somewhat intimidating high school student who is often misunderstood because of his appearance. However, he has a kind heart and is deeply loyal to his friends. His life changes when he saves a shy, sweet girl named Rinko Yamato from a train molester, and she falls in love with him. The anime explores their developing relationship, with Takeo's best friend, the charming and popular Sunakawa, playing a key role in their lives. The series is a heartwarming, romantic comedy that breaks away from typical romance tropes, focusing on the unique and sweet relationship between the two.

Ore Monogatari!! has 24 episodes, which aired from April to September 2015.
disclaimer: A romantic comedy with themes of self-discovery, love, and friendship. Generally family-friendly with mild romantic tension.

title: Ouran High School Host Club
description:
Ouran High School Host Club is a Japanese anime based on the manga by Bisco Hatori. The story follows Haruhi Fujioka, a scholarship student at the prestigious Ouran Academy. Haruhi stumbles upon the Host Club, a group of handsome boys who entertain female students by pretending to be charming suitors. After accidentally breaking a vase worth millions, Haruhi is forced to join the club to repay her debt. However, she keeps her true identity as a girl a secret, and her interactions with the eccentric and flamboyant host club members lead to humorous and heartwarming moments. The series is a romantic comedy that explores themes of identity, friendship, and love.

Ouran High School Host Club has 26 episodes, which aired from April to September 2006. Additionally, the anime has a special episode and an OVA (Original Video Animation).
disclaimer: Contains humor and romantic elements with some mild fanservice. Suitable for older teens and young adults.

title: Slam Dunk
description:
Slam Dunk is a classic Japanese anime based on the manga by Takehiko Inoue. The story follows Hanamichi Sakuragi, a high school delinquent with no interest in basketball, who is motivated to join the school team to impress a girl named Haruko Akagi. However, he soon discovers a natural talent for the sport and develops a deep passion for basketball. With the help of his teammates, including the talented and cool-headed Kaede Rukawa, Sakuragi grows both as a player and a person. The anime blends humor, drama, and intense basketball action, and it is widely regarded as one of the best sports anime of all time.

Slam Dunk has a total of 101 episodes, which aired from October 1993 to March 1996.
disclaimer: A sports anime focusing on basketball with themes of teamwork, rivalry, and perseverance. Mild violence due to sports competition.

title: Spy x Family
description:
Spy x Family is a Japanese anime based on the manga written by Tatsuya Endo. The story follows Twilight, a highly skilled spy working under the alias "Loid Forger," who is assigned a mission to infiltrate a prestigious school and get close to a target. To do so, he creates a fake family, adopting a young girl named Anya, who unbeknownst to him, has the ability to read minds. He also marries Yor, who is secretly an assassin. The series follows the comedic and heartwarming adventures of this unusual family as they navigate their respective secrets while trying to maintain the illusion of a perfect family life. The anime blends action, humor, and emotional moments as the characters grow closer despite their hidden identities.

As of now, Spy x Family has 2 seasons:
Season 1 – 25 episodes, aired from April to October 2022.
Season 2 – 12 episodes, aired from October to December 2023.
In total, there are 37 episodes across both seasons.
disclaimer: A comedy-action series with themes of family, espionage, and humor. Suitable for a broad audience with some mild action scenes.

title: Steins; Gate
description:
Steins;Gate is a Japanese anime based on the visual novel developed by 5bp and Nitroplus. The story follows Rintarou Okabe, a self-proclaimed "mad scientist" who accidentally discovers time travel using a microwave that sends messages to the past. Along with his friends, including the genius hacker Mayuri and the mysterious Kurisu, Okabe becomes embroiled in a complex and dangerous conspiracy that involves altering timelines and preventing catastrophic events. The series is a mix of science fiction, thriller, and emotional drama, exploring the consequences of time travel and the impact of decisions on the future.

Steins;Gate has 24 episodes in its main season, which aired from April to September 2011. There is also a special episode (Steins;Gate: Egoistic Poriomania) and a sequel series, Steins;Gate 0, which further explores the story.
disclaimer: A psychological sci-fi thriller that explores time travel, with intense emotional moments and some mature themes.

title: Sukitte Ii na yo
description:
Sukitte Ii na yo (also known as Say I Love You) is a Japanese anime based on the manga by Kanae Hazuki. The story follows Mei Tachibana, a shy, antisocial high school girl who has been hurt by others in the past and prefers to keep to herself. Her life changes when she meets Yamato Kurosawa, a popular and handsome boy who becomes interested in her. As their relationship develops, Mei learns to open up and trust others, while navigating the ups and downs of first love, friendship, and personal growth. The anime is a sweet, romantic drama that explores themes of vulnerability, acceptance, and the complexities of relationships.

Sukitte Ii na yo has 13 episodes, which aired from October 2012 to December 2012.
disclaimer: A romance with themes of personal growth, friendship, and love. Contains some emotional and mature themes.

title: Sword Art Online
description:
Sword Art Online is a Japanese anime based on the light novel series written by Reki Kawahara. The story is set in the near future, where players of a virtual reality MMORPG (Massively Multiplayer Online Role-Playing Game) called Sword Art Online are trapped inside the game. If they die in the game, they die in real life. The protagonist, Kirito, a skilled player, becomes one of the trapped players and works to clear the game's levels to escape. Along the way, he forms strong bonds with other players, including Asuna, a fellow gamer, and together they battle through the game’s dangerous challenges while trying to uncover its mysteries.

Sword Art Online has multiple seasons and arcs:
Season 1 (Aincrad and Fairy Dance Arcs) – 25 episodes, aired from July to December 2012.
Season 2 (Phantom Bullet, Calibur, and Mother's Rosario Arcs) – 24 episodes, aired from July to December 2014.
Season 3 (Alicization Arc) – 48 episodes, split into two parts (2018–2019).
Season 4 (Progressive: Aria of a Starless Night and Synthesis) – 23 episodes (ongoing as of 2024).
In total, as of 2024, Sword Art Online has 140 episodes across its various seasons and arcs.
disclaimer: Features virtual reality worlds and battles with occasional violence and darker themes surrounding survival and personal relationships.

title: Toradora!
description:
Toradora! is a Japanese anime based on the light novel by Yuyuko Tokemiya. The story revolves around two high school students: Ryuuji Takasu, a kind but misunderstood boy with an intimidating face, and Taiga Aisaka, a small but fiery and aggressive girl known as the "Palmtop Tiger." Despite their differences, the two form an unlikely friendship and agree to help each other with their respective crushes—Ryuuji’s on his best friend’s mother and Taiga’s on Ryuuji's close friend, Yuusaku. As the story progresses, their relationship deepens, and both characters undergo significant emotional growth, realizing that their feelings for each other may be more complicated than they initially thought.

Toradora! has 25 episodes, which aired from October 2008 to March 2009. It also has several special episodes and an OVA.
disclaimer: A romantic comedy-drama with themes of love, personal growth, and high school life. Contains mild emotional tension and mature themes.

title: Violet Evergarden
description:
Violet Evergarden is a Japanese anime based on the light novel by Kana Akatsuki. The story follows Violet Evergarden, a former child soldier who, after the war ends, struggles to find a new purpose in life. She begins working as an "Auto Memory Doll," a professional who writes letters for people to help them express their emotions. As Violet writes letters for others, she also embarks on a personal journey to understand her own feelings and come to terms with her past, particularly the loss of her beloved commander, Gilbert Bougainvillea. The anime is known for its stunning animation, emotional depth, and exploration of themes like love, loss, and healing.

Violet Evergarden has 13 episodes in its main season, which aired from January to April 2018. Additionally, there is a movie released in 2020 (Violet Evergarden: Eternity and the Auto Memory Doll), and another movie sequel released in 2021 (Violet Evergarden: The Movie).
disclaimer: A beautiful and emotionally intense story that deals with war, loss, and personal healing. Viewer discretion is advised for sensitive themes.

title: Your Lie in April
description:
Your Lie in April (also known as Shigatsu wa Kimi no Uso) is a Japanese anime based on the manga by Naoshi Arakawa. The story follows Kousei Arima, a piano prodigy who loses his ability to hear the sound of the piano after his mother’s death, leading him to quit playing music. His life changes when he meets a spirited and talented violinist named Kaori Miyazono, who encourages him to rediscover his love for music. As their relationship grows, Kousei learns to confront his past and the emotional scars left by his mother. The anime beautifully blends music, drama, and romance, exploring themes of love, loss, and healing.

Your Lie in April has 22 episodes, which aired from October 2014 to March 2015. It also has an additional 2 OVA episodes.
disclaimer: A drama about music, love, and personal growth, with emotionally intense moments that may be difficult for sensitive viewers.
